firstNightReminder: Choose a character type. Point to a player whose character is of that type. Place the Balloonist's 'Seen' reminder next to that character.
otherNightReminder: Point to a player whose character is different than the character type of the player marked with the 'Seen' reminder. Move the 'Seen' reminder next to that character.
name: Balloonist
ability: Each night, you learn a player of a different character type than last night. [+0 or +1 Outsider]

otherNightReminder: Show the hand signal for the number (0, 1, 2, etc.) for the number of players that nominated a player of different alignment today.
name: Messenger
ability: Each night*, you learn how many players nominated a player of different alignment.
flavor: Saying nothing is also saying something.

otherNightReminder: The Curator indicates nominated or were nominated. Show the appropriate character tokens plus one incorrect character token.
name: Curator
ability: Each night*, choose to learn either which characters nominated today or which characters were nominated today. Either way, you learn an additional incorrect character.
flavor: The more you see, the more you'll define your own taste.

name: Alsaahir
ability: Once per day, if you publicly guess which players are Minion(s) and which are Demon(s), good wins.

firstNightReminder: The Cuckoo points to a Townsfolk character. Mark that character with the Cuckoo's 'Craze' reminder.
name: Cuckoo
ability: You start by choosing a Townsfolk: if you are not mad that you are this character, your team may lose (even if dead).
flavor: The cuckoos remain silent for a long time (for several seasons) until they are able to sing sweetly (in the Spring) so as to give joy to all.

name: Ragtag
ability: Players that die after you lose their ghost vote.
flavor: Since the order of the world is shaped by death, mightn't it be better for God if we refuse to believe in Him and struggle with all our might against death, without raising our eyes toward the heaven where He sits in silence.

name: Zealot
ability: If there are 5 or more players alive, you must vote for every nomination.

firstNightReminder: The Skin-walker points to a Townsfolk character. Swap the out-of-play character token with the Skin-walker token and add the 'Is the Skin-walker' reminder. If the character is in play, place the 'Drunk' reminder by that player.
name: Skin-walker
ability: You start by choosing a Townsfolk: you gain their ability & register as that character. If this character is in play, they are drunk.
flavor: The wolf that wins is the one you feed.

firstNightReminder: The Sandman points to 2 players. Mark those players with the "Doesn't wake" reminder.
otherNightReminder: The Sandman points to 2 players. Mark those players with the "Doesn't wake" reminder.
name: Sandman
ability: Each night, choose 2 players: they don't wake tonight.
flavor: Sleep is good, death is better; but of course, the best thing would to have never been born at all

firstNightReminder: The Poppet points to a character. If that character is in play, they are poisoned.
otherNightReminder: The previously poisoned player is no longer poisoned. The Poppet points to a character. If that character is in play, they are poisoned.
name: Poppet
ability: Each night, choose a character: if in play, they are poisoned tonight and tomorrow day.
flavor: I say a little prayer for you.

firstNightReminder: While setting up the game, remove all Minion tokens and add Townsfolk or Outsider tokens. Wake the appropriate number of players directly clockwise and anti-clockwise from the Lord Of Typhon. Show each of these players a unique Minion token, and give a thumbs down. Replace these players' good character tokens with these Minion tokens and put these players to sleep.
otherNightReminder: The Lord of Typhon points to a player. That player dies.
name: Lord Of Typhon
ability: Each night*, choose a player: they die. [Evil characters are sat in a line. You are in the middle. +1 Minion. -? to +? Outisders]

otherNightReminder: The Sphinx points to a player. That player dies.
name: Sphinx
ability: Each night*, choose a player: they die. If you die (ending the game), publicly guess all players' characters. If you are correct, evil wins.
flavor: All is a riddle, and the key to a riddle... is another riddle.

firstNightReminder: At the start of the game, if there are any homebrew characters on the character sheet or you are running homebrew rules, declare that the Bootlegger is in play and inform the group of all the homebrew characters and/or rules you are using in this game.
name: Bootlegger
ability: This script has homebrew characters or rules.
